column4: f**k! I think I just erased my 600GB drive full of movies. Is there anyway to reverse this command? sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdb1
try photorec/testdisk but chances are low
It was only 164MB in before I stopped it
why do you care about the lost videos then?
Because it'll take me months to redownload them
you see, theres a reason even to backup this stuff next time :)
you are our hero, good luck with recovering
what do you expect after dd ing it?
why dod you use it then?
Because I was trying to repair a USB drive and someone told me to try that
someone fooled you or you got it wrong
those disk never come with unix-filesytems. make it ntfs/vfat whatever if youwant that
if you want to use ext4, sudo mount /dev/sdXY /wherever && sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /wherever
Made it NTFS, still not giving me permissions to access it though?
